title: Mark Zuckerberg will tell U.S. Congress Facebook is ‘not the ideal messenger’ for Libra
text:
The Facebook CEO will tell the House Financial Services Committee that Libra will not launch anywhere in the world until U.S. regulators are satisfied, according to prepared testimony released ahead of Wednesday’s appearance. He added that while he acknowledges criticisms of Facebook, he believes the project is “something that needs to get built.” (Reuters)

Talking point: Zuckerberg stopped short of saying Facebook should pull back from the project, and is sure to face critical questions from lawmakers on the committee, whose Democratic chairperson, Maxine Waters, has been a vocal critic of the Libra project. Facebook is also now facing the most coordinated antitrust investigation in U.S. history; attorneys general from 46 other states have joined New York’s sweeping bipartisan probe of the company’s market dominance and use of consumer data. Amid the increased scrutiny, Facebook is setting federal lobbying records—it spent US$4.8 million lobbying in Washington in the third quarter, up 70 per cent from the same period last year.
